title: Can you complete this sentence? “If pigs could fly, …” - Quora

response.answer_text: Premlatabahen Shah: Four previous answers have given you plenty of examples already, perhaps with the expectation that, after realizing that the expression “if pigs could fly” is used to express a humorous but ridiculous possibility, you would feel confident enough to come up with an example yourself. But apparently that may not be the case. Or perhaps you are curious about the extent of my wit. Instead of adding to the stash of illustrative examples already given, I will offer you a link that explains beautifully the origin of the expression: If wishes were horses, beggars would ride - Wikipedia Cheers! And keep learning. English, indeed every human language, is full of treasures to explore. You should see Spanish!”

You just reminded me of a funny/not so funny poem by (Turniquet?). A lyric. The first line was: “If pigs could fly they’d fly away and never grace the earth again” - Something to do with ‘Why God refuses to move (or to help)’. That’s all I remember. Sometimes the saying is used more prosaically in everyday speech, something like ; He’ll marry her when pigs can fly’, and so forth.
If pigs could fly… you’d realize that they are not bound by the laws of gravity! Or that perhaps you were on the moon where gravity didn’t have such a pull on pigs. :-D
If pigs could fly is a conditional statement that can be completed in any way,because it is an unrealistic hypothesis. If pigs could fly I could walk to the moon.
